• Background in Solid Mechanics.
• Experience with Creo or similar 3D CAD tools for mechanical design and modeling.
• Strong programming skills, especially in Python, for simulation automation and data processing.

job_title: Intern Performance Architecture & PnP Modeling Engineer
job_description:
• #getreadytogrow Are currently enrolled and studying towards a Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering of Computer Science Degree (Bachelors, Masters or PHD students welcome).
• Arm Internships require you to be enrolled in a higher education degree and be returning to your course after your internship/placement.
• Proficient in ReactJS, C/C++ programming language and Python scripting language skills.
• Good interpersonal skills with an analytical approach.
• Experienced Professionals Whatyou could be doing as a/an[enter job title] Intern.
• Working on interesting new projects with leaders in the field is exciting, but we also know how important it is to receive support.
• That's why throughout your internship, you can expect regular feedback and development opportunities, social activities to connect with your peers, an end of internship celebration, plus the opportunity to be *considered for future Graduate positions (*subject to performance).
• Understanding of general-purpose CPU microarchitecture, including knowledge of areas such as processor pipelines, caches, and memory hierarchy.
• Experienced Professionals.
• Experienced Professionals.

• Are currently enrolled and studying towards a Masters or PhD Degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering and are able to join our team for two consecutive semesters.
• Students will be considered if they have meaningful experience in circuit design and familiarity with SRAM design in course work.
• Arm Internships require you to be enrolled in a higher education degree and be returning to your course after your internship/placement.
• Good interpersonal skills with an analytical approach and adaptability and willing to learn how to use unfamiliar tools and systems.
• Programming and scripting skills in UNIX, Perl, Python, C++ or similar language.
• Experience with transistor level spice simulators such as SPICE or Spectre.
• Experienced Professionals.
• Working on interesting new projects with leaders in the field is exciting, but we also know how important it is to receive support.
